content: I'm super excited for this feature to be available: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/6605
do we know when that will be deployed on our instance? :)
Hosted instances get updates pretty regularly, I'm not sure exactly how frequently - but a PR I got merged into Zulip 2 days ago is available here, so it won't be long.
I know they like to backport stuff - my change was fairly low risk, so it could have been deployed quicker as a result

This has been live for a few days now; still labeled Beta, and under active development, but it's pretty solid already.

@nikomatsakis @Santiago Pastorino @davidtwco
(for anyone in the same boat as me wondering how to access it - I've not been able to find a button, but pressing t brings it up)
it's the little clock here image.png
Ah, very well hidden, thanks!
oh man
thanks for pointing that out
I would never have known it was there
right, it was very well hidden, good trick
I wonder now if someone has incorporated this to their workflow and how you're using the feature?
curious to learn ways to improve my workflow :)
it's not quite how I imagined it
I think what I imagined was something sort of like "@ Mentions"
like "My topics" with an unread count, over there in the side bar
or else like a "virtual stream"
By "my topics", do you mean topics that you started or that you participated in?
I do
I think this does that if you check the "participated" checkbox at the top?
yeah so if you check Unread + Participaetd + Muted
it kind of gives the behavior I want
just not presented the way I want
in particular I think that Muted does not mean only Muted, but "include both Muted and Unmuted"
that definitely seems to be the case
unmuted are already listed, "muted" is to include those; whereas "participated" isn't additive, it's taking away topics
worth filing an issue with them, particularly if this is a new feature that they're still experimenting with - they'll tag it as a "rust community request" if you mention it's from here
I guess one missing thing (depending on your POV) is that being mentioned doesn't count as participating
not entirely clear that it should, that's a bit tricky
Regarding the "hidden" button: the current plan is to eventually promote it to be the home view. It would be a full view like Mentions or Starred messages, not a modal.

I dont get these checkboxes... when I select "participated" and "muted", is that the intersection or the union of the two? it seems like neither... it shows more topics than just "participated", but just "muted" is empty!
when I select all 3 checkboxes that seems to be roughly what I want -- I think. but without understanding the semantics that is hard to tell.
The default view (no checkboxes) is all non-muted topics. Unread and Participated filter to only show topics that fit those descriptions, and Muted adds muted topics.
oh wow. that's very non-obvious.
funny, when I click just a bit too low below that button, the search bar opens...
Yes, I've done that several times as well; that whole header area is a click target for stream search, except for the buttons themselves.

davidtwco said:

worth filing an issue with them, particularly if this is a new feature that they're still experimenting with - they'll tag it as a "rust community request" if you mention it's from here
ah I had missed that, sorry
Nothing to be sorry about. :slight_smile:
I should have read the thread before replying ;)
anyway, here you go: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/15482
"Muted" has been changed to "Include muted" in a recent commit. I commented on the issue as well. @RalfJ
And now it's been moved next to the "All" button; I'm sure RalfJ knows already given the discussion on the issue, but for anyone else.
(no I dont, doesnt seem like there was a notification in the issue I am subscribed to)
Oh, well, there you go then. :big_smile:
